definition: to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
secret/hidden/concealed/(prefix) crypto-
to lean upon
to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark
to cover up (a matter that should be reported to the authorities)

sentences.english: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it
sentences.chinese: 就是智慧人从列祖所受，传说而不隐瞒的。

sentences.english: But drug companies have repeatedly been shown to bury unflattering data.
sentences.chinese: 然而制药公司却一再隐瞒那些对自己不利的数据。

sentences.english: Those companies did not dispute their relationship with the manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 这些公司都未隐瞒它们与鸿海精密的合作关系。

sentences.english: Perhaps this concealment, this disguise, was beneath me.
sentences.chinese: 我这样隐瞒，这样欺蒙，也许失掉了我自己的身份。

sentences.english: The president tried to sweep the embarassing incident under the rug.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图隐瞒领事馆事件。

sentences.english: It is impossible to disguise the fact that business is bad.
sentences.chinese: 生意萧条这一事实是无法隐瞒的。

sentences.english: It frees you from the burden of shaded truths and the oppression they bring.
sentences.chinese: 它使你免受隐瞒真相的负担及其带来的压力。

sentences.english: You should tell her the truth, and be done with it.
sentences.chinese: 你应该告诉她真相，不要在隐瞒事实了。

sentences.english: What this does is hides the cost from the consumer.
sentences.chinese: 说白了，这样做就是向消费者隐瞒这笔开支。

sentences.english: The doctor decided that he could not hide the condition from the old man any longer.
sentences.chinese: 医生决定不能再对老人隐瞒病情。

sentences.english: Hitachi doesn't always withhold its design secrets.
sentences.chinese: 日立公司也并不总是隐瞒其设计机密。

sentences.english: Beijing denounced the Japanese vessel for shadowing exercises by some of its own warships.
sentences.chinese: 北京则谴责日本舰船隐瞒其军舰的军事演习。

sentences.english: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.chinese: 在公开露面的场合，他也不刻意隐瞒他的博学多闻。

sentences.english: There is more in Mary's refusal than meets the eye; I think she's trying to hide something.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽的拒绝另有隐情，我想她是在力图隐瞒什么东西。

sentences.english: To hide such a bad habit from one's family is pathetic.
sentences.chinese: 试图向家人隐瞒这种坏习惯，真没出息。

sentences.english: There probably was something more to conceal than her own preference;
sentences.chinese: 也许，简要隐瞒的还不仅仅是自己的隐衷。

definition: honest/forthcoming/to confess
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
actual situation/truth
to tell lies
to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
variant of 交代[jiao1 dai4]
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
to hand over/to explain/to make clear/to brief (sb)/to account for/to justify oneself/to confess/(coll.) to finish
as things really are/realistic
to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to deceive/to cheat
to have misgivings/apprehension/worry/qualm/scruple
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
